edu.nd.darts.cimon
Class ConditionTree

java.lang.Object
  edu.nd.darts.cimon.ConditionTree

public class ConditionTree
extends Object

A binary tree which represents an active event notification or conditional monitor. This object contains a reference to the root node of a binary tree which represents an active event notification or conditional monitor. For event notifications, _callback_ will be a PendingIntent; for conditional monitors _callback_ will be a Messenger. This object maintains the state of the full condition, and will activate the conditional periodic monitor or initiate a notification to the client when the conditions state changes to true.

This class also provides methods for constructing a new tree (by parsing the expression string) or removing a tree. The nodes of the tree are all implementations of ExpressionNode.

Author:
darts
See Also:
ExpressionNode, EventList

Constructor Detail

ConditionTree

ConditionTree(int _monitorId,
              long _period,
              PendingIntent _callback,
              long _duration,
              Handler _handler)
Instantiate a new object for an event notification monitor.

Parameters:
_monitorId - unique id of monitor
_period - maximum allowed period between updates, in milliseconds
_callback - defines Intent that should be broadcast to notify client that event has triggered
_duration - duration to monitor (in milliseconds), 0 for continuous
_handler - handler of thread for all event notification activity

ConditionTree

ConditionTree(int _metric,
              int _monitorId,
              long _period,
              Messenger _callback,
              long _duration,
              Handler _handler)
Instantiate a new object for a conditional monitor.

Parameters:
_metric - integer representing metric (per Metrics) to monitor
_monitorId - unique id of monitor
_period - period between updates, in milliseconds
_callback - messenger for client callback handler to handle periodic updates
_duration - duration to monitor (in milliseconds), 0 for continuous
_handler - handler of thread for all event notification activity

Return Handler of thread for all event notification activity.

Callback registered for this monitor.

isTriggered

public boolean isTriggered()
Has the event triggered (is state of event true?).

Returns:
true if state of event is true

getPeriod

public long getPeriod()
Get period of monitor. Period represents period for periodic updates of conditional monitor, or maximum allowable period between updates of conditions in event notification monitor.

Returns:
period for monitor, in milliseconds

removeTree

private void removeTree()
Remove all elements of tree and remove tree from EventList.

removeEvent

public void removeEvent()
Remove monitor in response to monitor being unregistered by client. For conditional monitors, remove periodic monitor if currently active. Clear tree and remove from EventList.

trigger

public void trigger()
State of event has changed to true. For conditional monitors, activate periodic monitor of metric. For event notification monitors, notify client with Intent, then clear tree and remove monitor.

untrigger

public void untrigger()
State of event has changed to false. This should only be called for conditional monitors (since event notification monitors would be removed immediately following a trigger). Deactivate periodic monitor.

constructTree

public boolean constructTree(String exp)
Parse expression string and construct new event tree. Set root to root node of newly constructed event tree.

Parameters:
exp - expression string representing event to monitor
Returns:
true if parsing and tree construction succeeded

expressionParser

private ExpressionNode expressionParser(String exp)
Parses expression string and constructs a boolean expression tree.

Parameters:
exp - expression string representing event to be monitored
Returns:
root node of newly constructed expression tree
